txt.en:
'The goblin Thraunákh must be in Târ-kútoz, holed up with all the bats he needs to create his sapper-bombs. We won't find him outside; I doubt the bats would willingly suffer the elements. Which means... they've made the watch-tower Atrad-zarakh their new home.

'If we are to stop Thraunákh, we must first clear out a path through Târ-kútoz. We ought to target the Orc-sentries -- they are the eyes and ears of the camp.

'I'll come with you. I have no desire to see another dwarf get hurt --

'Ah, wait a moment. It seems that Mekhnet has something to say to you.'
A recently-arrived Mekhnet wishes to speak with you.
Eyes are set on the goblin Thraunákh in Atrad-zarakh, but the Orc camp of Târ-kútoz remains an obstacle.
You have defeated as many Orc-sentries as you could find.\n\nYou should report back to Lúka in Ashmargathâl.
'I should have known better than to trust Mekhnet the moment you disappeared. But what's done is done -- getting into Atrad-zarakh will be safer now. '

'I am putting my foot down -- Lúka needs her rest! I know you can handle yourself, maybe even better alone than accompanied by a sleep-deprived dwarf.\n\n'Quickly, let me distract her. Head to Târ-kútoz, defeat their sentries, and come straight back. I wouldn't want you entering that watch-tower without help!'
Orc-sentries can be found in Târ-kútoz.\n\nYou should defeat them to ensure easier access to Atrad-zarakh later.
